content: It sounds like you are referring to the Spanish conquistador Hernando de Soto. De Soto led an expedition through what is now the southeastern United States from 1539 to 1542. He was the first European to explore much of the region, and his expedition played a significant role in the history of the Americas. De Soto and his men traveled through present-day Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, Tennessee, Alabama, Mississippi, Arkansas, and Oklahoma, among other places. They encountered many Native American tribes and played a major role in the spread of diseases like smallpox and influenza, which had a significant impact on the indigenous population.
